title: 105_s1885
content: CREDIT FOR CLINICAL TESTING RESEARCH EXPENSES ATTRIBUTABLE TO QUALIFIED ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS INCLUDING TEACHING HOSPITALS. Amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to include a new section 41A for a credit for medical innovation expenses. The medical innovation credit under section 38 is 20% of qualified medical innovation expenses exceeding the medical innovation base period amount. Qualified expenses are those paid to qualified academic institutions for clinical testing research activities. The research activities for medical innovation credit involve human clinical testing at qualified academic institutions before product approval or licensing. The term 'product' under the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act includes drugs, biologics, and medical devices. A 'qualified academic institution' refers to educational institutions or charitable research hospitals meeting specific criteria. The term 'qualified medical innovation expenses' excludes amounts funded by grants or contracts. The 'medical innovation base period amount' is the average annual expenses in the three years before 1998. Special Rules for the tax credit include limitations on foreign testing, application of certain rules, an election requirement for taxpayers, and coordination with other research expense credits. The tax credit for medical innovation expenses under section 41A is not considered for the general business credit under section 38(b) or the deduction for unused portion of credit under section 196(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The tax credit for medical innovation expenses under section 41A is not considered for the general business credit under section 38(b) or the deduction for unused portion of credit under section 196(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to the table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendments made by section 41A for the credit for medical innovation expenses will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 1997.
